main event: On 23 February 1961, witnesses observed a very bright white object in Oakwood, Ohio, which was described as being the size of a star and moving very fast before disappearing to the horizon.
interesting points: A total of 5 witnesses, including 4 adults and 1 child, observed the sighting., The object was described as very bright and moved quickly., The sighting lasted for 2 minutes., The object appeared to turn slightly toward the horizon before it vanished., The investigation concluded that there was insufficient data for evaluation.
